subject: Career
title: Bridges' Transition Model
description: A micro-lesson that makes Bridges' Transition Model usable.

hook.text: Change is situational: a new job. Transition is psychological: becoming a new professional. They're different.

buildup.text: William Bridges identified three phases: Ending (letting go), Neutral Zone (limbo), New Beginning.

discovery.text: Most people rush through the Neutral Zone. But it's where real transformation happens.

twist.text: The Neutral Zone feels like failure â€” you're not the old thing or the new thing yet. It's actually growth.

climax.text: Embrace the discomfort of in-between. Experiment, reflect, and let the new identity form naturally.

punchline.text: The messiest phase is where the real change happens.

quiz.question: What are the three phases in Bridges' Transition Model?
